div1.p: Carter writes about his work, health, and living conditions.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, October 25, [19--]
div1.opener:
FIREPROOF
CUR NON
The
Lafayette
“Hotel de Luxe”
IN THE CIVIC CENTER OF
New Orleans
SECOND PORT U.S.A.
October 25
Dear Laura:
div1.p:
This is the first time I have had a
chance to write to you & it comes because in-
stead of going up early to the Hospital I am
staying down town until 9. O clock. so as
to call on the Plague gang of ser-
vice men - over on Dryads street.
In the mean time Miss Riva will
came down town & buy a Liberty
Bond. M.(?) bought one last issue
I saw it. I think he bought but one
but I don't Know - $50. 00/100

I am changing my sleeping place
FIREPROOF
CUR NON
The
Lafayette
“Hotel de Luxe”
IN THE CIVIC CENTER OF
New Orleans
SECOND PORT U.S.A.
2
today - $2 00/100 per day (at first - (now $1.50
without bath) - is too much for a room,
also it is 50 minutes from the office
& lunch is a problem. I am
going up where Griffitts boarded
on Peters avenue a little over a
mile from the hospital, 16 or 17 squares,
where I can live better: be
closer & live cheaper, Here the
street cars break my rest.
5.30 P. M.- I have changed my boarding
3
FIREPROOF
CUR NON
The
Lafayette
“Hotel de Luxe”
IN THE CIVIC CENTER OF
New Orleans
SECOND PORT U.S.A.
Place & am continuing my this letter
there-

I rec'd this morning - your letter en-
closing one from Goragas & one from Henry & the Cali-
fornia brochure & by the noon mail
the rubber Cafe- The little
red notebook is not to hand yet -
maybe you did not send it on timea
at the same time as the other.

I am not overly well, The cold hurt
me- It is broken today - & I have
had a slight headache over my
right temple - 3 days - possibly
4 days
C1
B20
4
It feels just like it did when
going down to Culon last time
- like a malarial neuralgia. Neither
then nor now does the blood show
it, yet the first time it was relie-
ved bywhen I took Quinine. & I took 10 grains
at noon & am going to try it any
way. It comes on about 10.30 to 11
A. M. l lasts all day- Have slept
well the last two nights too

I am going to write to Gorgas &
ask if he received my other
letter,- will write this mail,

All goes quite well with the
Memphis project- Heard from the
“Cotton Belt”
C1
B20
5
people - our Hovenberg - the Sanitary
Engineer in charge of their work will
read his paper: The Crossett man
“Comes across” Patterson does
not. & I don't much care, I have his
original letter to our Ezdorf. The only
vacant place is - that for the Drainage
Engineer- I wrote yesterday to the
Memphis firm- (Mr Hedinger) &
if he don't accept I am satisfied

I went to see Bass yesterday- He was
in Jackson - saw Johns., his assis-
tant & king - the Entomologist,

Also made out and signed Florence's bills
yesterday- Indeed my work.- except
C1
B20
6
for an hour or twos reading & the prep-
eration of a letter to Trask- wire-
Morbidity Statistics-is up to date,

Miss Canty isn't here - Abolished
the place & thus got rid of her

Have just came up from dinner
It was better & was abundant than
I have been getting - also my room
is lighter: more airy & larger
than I had.- I am sorry to say that
it faces on Peters Avenue on
which runs a line of cars
but 3 or 4 lines run on
St. Charles - in part of the other one.

Also I will walk to the hospital &
thus insure exercise- Also room &
two meals is 50 cents less per week than
old room was.

I count it again all around,
Love to the Pet wet & Mary: My
money will hold
out to Novem 1 to1011 or 12
Daddy
possibly - to Nov12
div1.closer:
H. R. Carter you have attended to everything
all right wisely &
promptly
H. R.
